text: <a href="../1-Corinthians-16-1/" title="1 Corinthians 16:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-2/" title="1 Corinthians 16:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Upon the first *day* of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as *God* hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-3/" title="1 Corinthians 16:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by *your* letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-4/" title="1 Corinthians 16:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-5/" title="1 Corinthians 16:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-6/" title="1 Corinthians 16:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-7/" title="1 Corinthians 16:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-8/" title="1 Corinthians 16:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-9/" title="1 Corinthians 16:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and *there are* many adversaries.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-10/" title="1 Corinthians 16:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also *do*.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-11/" title="1 Corinthians 16:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-12/" title="1 Corinthians 16:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 As touching *our* brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-13/" title="1 Corinthians 16:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-14/" title="1 Corinthians 16:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Let all your things be done with charity.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-15/" title="1 Corinthians 16:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and *that* they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-16/" title="1 Corinthians 16:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with *us*, and laboureth.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-17/" title="1 Corinthians 16:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-18/" title="1 Corinthians 16:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-19/" title="1 Corinthians 16:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-20/" title="1 Corinthians 16:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-21/" title="1 Corinthians 16:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 The salutation of *me* Paul with mine own hand.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-22/" title="1 Corinthians 16:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-23/" title="1 Corinthians 16:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ *be* with you.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-16-24/" title="1 Corinthians 16:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 My love *be* with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen. (*The first *epistle* to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus and Timotheus.*)
